page.title: 08Typical day in Bridlington,1
page.content: It's Tuesday;I get up at 7:30 for school. I set off for school at 8:25 with my mate Lynn. We walk across the road and wait for our other friend called Kerry who lives at Burton Fleming and has to come by bus. Our lessons start at 9:20, first we have a double lesson of cooking then we have a double lesson of biology. Then I go home for my dinner and arrive back at school at 12:50. My lessons in the afternoon are French with Miss Metcalfe, Maths with Mr Lewis and English with Mr Bradshaw. We go home at 3:30 and at 4:30 I set off on my bike for work. I work at the Pembroke Hotel and as soon as I arrive I fill all the water jugs and put them on the tables. Then I go round with the bread -buns and fruit juice. I bang the gong serve the soup, then the first course, then the sweet and the coffee.(Cont)
